meanings.def: a device that uses electricity, oil or gas to produce light
examples: (especially North American English) a kerosene lamp
to switch on/turn off a lamp
An oil lamp burned in the darkness.
The study was lit only by a small lamp.
He got into bed and switched off the bedside lamp.
She could see the rain in the light of the street lamps.
There were oil lamps hanging over the veranda.

meanings.def: an electrical device that produces rays of heat and that is used for medical or scientific purposes
examples: The specimen was viewed under an ultraviolet lamp.
lamp somebody The guy lamped me.
lamp somebody something I'd have lamped her one!
